intro: Astragalus neomexicanus, commonly known as New Mexico milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern in some regions.
